content.question: The position-time graph shown represents the motion of a car moving along a straight road during the time interval <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math>. Consider the instantaneous speed at two different times as <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> at <math alttext="t equals 1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="v sub 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>5</mn></msub></math> at <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math> and the average speed <math alttext="v sub average" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub></math> over the entire time interval. Which of the following is the correct ranking of these three speeds?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub average, which is less than v sub 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>1</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>5</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 5 equals, v sub average, which is less than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>5</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>1</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub average is less than v sub 5, which is less than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>5</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub average is less than v sub 5, which equals v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>5</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 5 equals, v sub average, which is less than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>5</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>avg</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>1</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
